turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about The Dregs.
turn.1: What was The Dregs' early years like?
turn.2: By this time, the band had established itself as a local comedy and music act with several bars, music venues, conventions, and private events in the Minneapolis/St. Paul metropolitan area, as well as additional Renaissance faires in the Midwest.
turn.4: Vocalist and comedian Angelia Lais departed from the act following The Dregs Holiday Special performance in December 2009.
turn.6: Interested in expanding instrumentation, mezzo-soprano and violinist (and occasional violist/mandolin player) Molly Zupon was recruited in early 2010. Frost Simula left the band at the end of 2011 at which time Geoffrey M. Brown, who had been participating with The Dregs throughout 2011, joined the group as the guitarist.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: The Dregs released their seventh album " Do It Like You're Drunk" in 2012.
turn.10: In 2013, The Dregs took their comedy show to the Minnesota Fringe Festival in a tongue and cheek one-act called 'A Brief History of Irish Music'.
turn.11: What other shows did they do?
turn.12: Also in 2013, they collaborated with fellow local Irish band Four Pints Shy on live recording, "2 Bands 1 Show".
